column4: Can anyone tell me the benefits of installing a proxy server on my machine? and what distro would you recommend??
normally one connects to a proxy.. you planning on having other machines connect to that one? If not - not much need for a proxy on a single machine.
I was told that its a good way to secure my identity when posting on forums.
that makes very little sence..
if you want to use a proxy then do so.. but running the proxy on the same machine yoy are using. makes no sence to me as being any more 'secure'
if you want to be truely paranoid. theres the 'TOR' security proxy system. but thats a bit overkill
hahaha, I don't know, its what i read today, something to do with IP masking of some sort as others can see your IP when you post and then run snort or something to get into open ports
if you got no services running.. then you got no ports.. they could just be scanning random ip's  and find people easier..
if you are behind a router. then most ports will be blocked anyway
so how is it that after posting on a forum, another user can obtain my ip without help from the admin..?
i would like to see 'proof' that is possible.
sounds like a goofed up forum to me.. or a  myth.

well maybe a goofed up forum, i won't reveal the URL here in public, for the other users safety, but i've seen someone do it... Don't know how they did it... Thought I might ask some brilliant minds here to see who might have insight.
the reason I know it was done is because the admin removed the post after about 30 minutes and asked that people not post other persons IPs... :s so i dunno
just getting someones ip shouldent be a security issue - i mean they could just start scaning your ip if they saw that..
just thought it might be worth my while to figure it out and try to find a way to not let that happen to me in the future
ok thanks
so do what you want.. i would just not use that forum any more if you consider it a security risk. or use that 'onion router' project for paranoid-level-security to hide your ip
a proxy will slow down your  browser.
just being here on IRC could be considered a bigger risk then that forum i  imagine.
hahaha, thats comforting.. lol
some times it returns your actual ip. some times ya gotta do a little more work to get the ip.
so as we said. just getting someones ip. is not that huge a security hole.
thanks
